meanings.definition: Sleep or settle in a temporary or improvised place.
meanings.sent1: After the camping trip, we were dossing in the backyard tent.
meanings.sent2: The homeless man was dossing under the bridge to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: When the power went out, we ended up dossing in the living room by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The cat found a cozy spot dossing in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent5: The hikers were dossing under the stars, surrounded by nature's sounds.

meanings.definition: To sleep in a rough or makeshift bed.
meanings.sent1: The kids were dossing on the floor with their sleeping bags during the sleepover.
meanings.sent2: The soldier was dossing on a cot in the barracks.
meanings.sent3: After the move, we were dossing on an air mattress until our bed arrived.
meanings.sent4: The traveler was dossing on a thin mat in the hostel.
meanings.sent5: The dog was dossing on a pile of blankets in the corner of the room.

meanings.definition: To sleep in a casual or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: She was dossing on the couch while watching TV.
meanings.sent2: The student was dossing in class, missing important information.
meanings.sent3: He ended up dossing through the alarm, waking up late for work.
meanings.sent4: The cat was dossing lazily in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent5: The tired toddler was dossing in the stroller during the walk.
